title: tool to see diferences in subfamilies
content:
Hello everybody!  
I need a little help, please.  
I need a tip, don't you know whether exists some tool which I can use to see diferences in subfamilies of my font? I mean something like covering outlines of each subfamily, each on other. I hope you understood that description in my bone breaking English, thanks for every reply.
author: Honzojd

comments.content:
FontForge, open two fonts and:  
Element -\> Compare Fonts  
 [http://fontforge.github.io/elementmenu.html#CompareFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141111092347/http:/fontforge.github.io/elementmenu.html#CompareFonts "http://fontforge.github.io/elementmenu.html#CompareFonts")

You may also try Yanones Autopsy:  
 [https://github.com/davelab6/autopsy](http://web.archive.org/web/20141111092347/https:/github.com/davelab6/autopsy "https://github.com/davelab6/autopsy")

A video about this tool is here:  
 [http://vimeo.com/38489608](http://web.archive.org/web/20141111092347/http:/vimeo.com/38489608 "http://vimeo.com/38489608")

Best  
Eigi
